text: Richard Brousek (12 January 1931 – 28 November 2015) was an Austrian football player. The striker played mainly for Wacker Wien. He also played for the Austrian national football team and in the Netherlands. ==Career == Richard Brousek started at Wiener AC and moved to SC Wacker Wien in October 1948. There he stayed 10 seasons. During this time he became 3 times runner up in the championship. 1955 he became top scorer of the league with 31 goals in 25 matches. In 1958 the striker went to the Dutch club SC Enschede in the Eredivisie. After two years with Be Quick he went back to Austria and played again for Wacker Wien. ==International == In 1955 he played 4 matches for Austria . His debut was on 24 April in a 2-2 versus Hungary. His last match was on 23 November in a 2-1 away win versus Wales. title: Richard Brousek
